lines.text: I've said it before and I'll say it again - War stories and monster movies are educational. They're survival oriented. They always neutralize the enemy in the end.

[MTV is on the TV]
Intellectual decay! Turn it off, it'll rot your brain cells! It's an international conspiracy!
Hey, little dude, you like metal? Kiss the boot.
Kiss the ass, bozo.
People of Earth, you must heed my warning. Destroy your satellite receivers, dismantle your communications systems, render your TV sets inoperable for the next 200 Earth years.
Fantastic idea for a movie! Martians diddling the women of the universe.
Yeah, you got it, Spiro. Intergalactic swingers.
Shut up about the monster! I'm gonna make you take your pill.
Pills? What color?
Follow me.
Alright, dude! Pill freak!
Remember that movie? You know, the one about the little space guy? Made you cry like a butthole.
This is music. Mu-sic. It's almost as important as food.
[last lines]
The studio, Al, and make it snappy! Come on, come on, come on!
The beast has ingested Earthlings? Oh dear heavens, I'll lose my position for this.

[stroking her snake hair]
I went to my hairdresser today to try my hair ratted. You like? Oh, it's really something to see. We use *live* rats, you know. Snakes just eat 'em up. MmmMmm.
Pleasant dreams, kiddies!

[while hitting Pluthar with her purse]
Ugly bastard!
O.D., maaan!
It's O.D.
O who?
O.D., my new boyfriend.
Oh. Irish boy?

[talking about the Jacuzzi]
Is it cool if I get in there?
Cool? Babe, it's a perfect 98.6. It's like floating in your mother's womb!
A stray energy beam from my substation may be headed for your solar system, and could possibly result in the total annihilation of your species. I'm so terribly sorry for the inconvenience.
This is TV. T-V. Next to food and music, this is mankind's greatest invention.
[first lines]
Stanley! Stanley! Quit screwing around... Stanley! Stanley, I'm right in the middle of my program. For Christ's sakes, Stanley!
Lay off me, Beautiful. I almost got this baby wired.
Did you see that? He looked right at my studs and cooled out. This dude's into metal!
Please, Earthling, there is little time. I've come to exterminate the hungry beast.
Like, what is going on around here? What is a hungry beast?

On my planet, the hungry beast is a house pet similar to your Earthly dogs and cats. But, they are highly unstable, prone to mutate wildly and eat everything in sight. When mutation occurs, they must be exterminated at once.
You mean, like, he was somebody's pet?
Oh yes, they're very lovable... before they mutate.
Sherman fooood!
[Sherman blows up the room in which he is trapped with an alien]
Did you feel something?
Yeah, like, 3.5 on the Richter scale.
[an alien is on TV, "warning" humans about the invasion]

[to Sherman and Suzy]
Hey, check out this stupid movie. It's just this one guy talking.
[Sherman is shooting at aliens as they chase him, Suzy, and O.D]
Don't shoot me, dude!
[an alien makes a farting noise with its mouth]
Woah, I hope this guy's house trained!
[the Puttermans discover slime in the Jacuzzi]
Spiro...? Cherry...?
What the Hell did that homo do to the Jacuz'?
Maybe Spiro's cocktail made someone sickie-poo.
You know, you really got a cute kid there. Have you ever thought about putting him in the movies? I mean, I know a really sweet agent.
Oh, God no. Sherman's much too neurotic to be an actor.
Yeah, the only thing the kid is interested in is being a soldier.
Ahh, such a manly pursuit - raping and pillaging and creating life, but taking it away. Like the gods of the ancient Greeks.
I had a date the other night. Poor fellow. I turned all of the lights off. I whispered to him, "Whatever you do, honey, don't look at me. One glance and you're hard as a rock."
[Medusa rests her hand on a statue's shoulder]
Needless to say, poor guy... peeked. Now you see why I have this *thing* for phone friends.
